result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody T Korth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1.  AODA and any follow-up
2.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
3.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
4.  No contact with any known drug dealers
5.  Defendant is to complete an emotional and mental health assessment and any follow-up
6.  Defendant is to seek or maintain full-time employment.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the sentences to be consecutive to each other (2014CF106) and consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.  Sentences are to commence immediately.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Current: 403 Jackson St, C/O Columbia County Jail, Portage, WI 53901 United States  (Effective: 04-16-2018)

3:42 p.m.  Defendant in csutody and present in court with Atty William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon - has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Lennon.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF62 - 1 year of Initial Confinement and  2 years of Extended Supervision.
2014CF106 - 2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision.

Court orders the sentences to be consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.
Sentences are to commence immediately.

CONDITIONS(both cases):

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Court re-imposes the court costs of $518.00 on 2014CF62.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Court re-imposes the court costs of $18.00 on 2014CF106.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court grants the defendant 222 days of sentence credit.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Programs.

Court adjourned at 3:59 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 10, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 15, 2018 at 09:00 am.
By Atty William Lennon
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 20, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Statement by the Court - informs the defendant that Atty Lennon has been appointed to his cases.  Statement by defendant - no objection to adjourning this out.  No objection by DA Christenson.  Court adjourns to March 20, 2018 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:07 p.m.
Letter from Atty William Lennon dated March 2, 2018 re: requests court date be scheduled.

Sentencing hearing at 07-20-2015 11:45 am

2:11 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has filed a motion to dismiss on 2015CM54.  Statement by DA - does not oppose the motion to dismiss.  Statement by the Court in regards to the motion to dismiss and grants the defense motion to dismiss without prejudice.

Statement by Atty Privat in regards to sentencing on the other cases.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  No objection by DA to adjourn.  Court will set for sentencing on July 20, 2015 at 11:45 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:15 p.m.
Sentencing hearing at 07-14-2015 02:00 pm
to counsel with a copy of the presentence investigation report
to Agent Bret Grant - Court grants the extension to file the PSI.  PSI is due no later than May 27, 2015
from Agent Bret Grant requesting a 7 day extension to file the PSI.
Columbia County Jail - 06/08/2015 at 8:30 a.m. (Sentencing)
Sentencing hearing at 06-08-2015 09:00 am

3:27 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2014CF62 with no enhancer; count 1 on 2014CF106; count 2 amended to OWI-3rd offense on 2014CF132 and count 2 amended to OWI-4th offense on 2014CF133.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by the Court - will be ordering a PSI on this case and states reasons.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will enter a plea today.  Defendant concurs.

2014CF132 - Atty Privat and defendant have received a copy of the amended information and waive reading.  Court goes over penalties.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 on 2014CF62; count 1 on 2014CF106 and count 2 amended to OWI-3rd offense on 2014CF132 and count 2 amended to OWI-4th offense on 2014CF133.  Court orders the enhancer on 2014CF62, count 3 on 2014CF132 & count 3 on 2014CF133 be dismissed, counts 2 & 3 on 2014CF106, count 1 on 2014CF132 and count 1 on 2014CF133 are to be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.

2014CF133 - Atty Privat and defendant have received a copy of the amended information and waive reading.

Court orders a PSI to be conducted and filed within 60 days.  Sentencing to be scheduled.  

Statement by DA regarding bond.  Court revokes the bond on 2014CF133 and remands the defendant to the custody of the GLSO.

Court adjourned at 3:46 p.m.
